website_summaries.verdict: Fitbit Ace tracks your child's steps, active minutes and sleep, and lets them challenge friends to fitness contests.
pros: Tracks child's steps, active minutes, and sleep
Lets kids challenge others to contests and send messages and cheers
Syncs wirelessly to iOS and Android devices
cons: Band may not fit all children, but you can purchase an interchangeable Fitbit Alta band to use
Can be challenging to link and sync with parent account

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced - pretty much the same price as the adult Alta, which makes sense, because pretty much it IS the Adult Alta but with a smaller band and the ability to use the children’s app which allows parent control of settings and data. Purchased in June when it first came out and have not regretted buying it. Really motivates her to move more, especially when Nana has more steps 😊
customer_reviews.author: dauba

customer_reviews.title: Band too small for my 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: The band on the Ace is too small it doesn’t fit my 10 year old average sized daughter. Fitbit customer service told me I could order an Alta band to fit. This is very disappointing since I have to pay another $30 for a band. Would be better if they actually made a band that fit older kids. I would say that the band is made for kids 4-8 not 8+ because it fits my 6 year old perfectly
customer_reviews.author: R. Nachmann

customer_reviews.title: Small and limited
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old and the band didn't fit her so I had to buy adult size bands. The idea is cool but the functionality is really limited. I should have just purchased her an alta, more than likely I'll end of giving her my charge 2 and getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: kf

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to see others haven't had a great experience with this product, but I'm very happy so far! I have an average size 9 year old and the band fits him perfectly with room to grow. It has all the features I want, and works perfectly with my fitbit app. I'll update this review as time goes on!
customer_reviews.author: Drea

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise like it and it is successful at motivating my child ...
customer_reviews.text: We continually have trouble getting it to automatically sync. Have Googled for help and it seems the only way around it is to plug it into the USB and turn it off (press button on charger 3 times), then it reboots, at which time it will sync. Otherwise like it and it is successful at motivating my child to be more active. Note that the band that comes with it is way too small for my 11 year old. Fits better on my 6 year old. We bought generic Alta bands instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Winland

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter asked for 2 things for her 8th birthday. A fitbit, and a baby panda. This seemed like the realistic way to go. She loves it, and beats me in every challenge. I'm satisfied with the purchase, and humiliated by my constant defeat. It's rugged enough to stand up to her constant movement, and fashionable enough that she likes to wear it with everything. She's very conscientious of her movement and sleep habits now, and enjoys engaging others in physical activity. That's what it's all about, so bravo! I understand you pay for the name, but realistically, it could probably cost a little less, only true complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Insomniac of two

customer_reviews.title: Fit Bit Ace
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent for kids. Got one for my 10 year old and one for my 6 year old. Comes with 2 different bands for various wrist sizes. I have the fitbit charge 3 so we all have a competition to see who can get the most exercise in daily. I never win but it keeps them motivated beating dad. Also has silent alarms which vibrate on your wrist. Surprisingly powerful enough to wake me up. Not sure about them yet. I would recommend this device!
customer_reviews.author: kevin sanders

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Kids
customer_reviews.text: My son really enjoys tracking his daily steps and sleep cycles. I am a little disappointed that it doesn't track heart rate activity, I could have just as easily purchased a less expensive brand if I understand there were very little features other than the step counting. However, I will keep the 4 starts because the quality is good especially for an active kid, and I do like that I can sync it with my own fitbit app.
customer_reviews.author: Shayna R.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 days - HOT to the touch & wont

Called fitbit customer service and they will send me a new one but only after I return this one and then they will send me the info on how to obtain a replacement. So she will not have I for our trip next week.

It’s difficult to turn off the alarms. They became annoying. The screen is unresponsive. Step count is not accurate. We have other Fitbits that work so much better and are over 3 years old. We are not new to using them. This one just really doesn’t work.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to het the kids started

Would I recommend this sure...I'm not sure unless you are ok buying extra bands.

feature_bullets: Tracks steps, active minutes and sleep and shows stats on a bright, tap the display
Reward kids for hitting goals with celebratory messages and achievement badges. Kids can challenge others to step competitions, plus send each other messages or cheers
A showerproof tracker that survives splashes and spills with a secure, adjustable wristband for growing kids (one size). Designed for wrist sizes up to 155 mm/6.10 in.
Syncs stats wirelessly and automatically to iOS & Android devices and has a battery life up to 5 days (varies with use and other factors)
In the Fitbit app, parents create an account for their child under a family account (family account and parental consent required for children 12 and under)
